title: Who is Daniel Driscoll? Donald Trump’s pick for Secretary of Army
content: President-elect Donald Trump nominated Daniel P. Driscoll for Secretary of the Army. Driscoll, a veteran, venture capitalist, and former advisor to JD Vance, boasts a distinguished career including military service in Iraq and a law degree from Yale. Trump lauded Driscoll as a champion for soldiers and the America First agenda.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump nominated Daniel P. Driscoll for Secretary of the Army. Driscoll, a veteran, venture capitalist, and former advisor to JD Vance, boasts a distinguished career including military service in Iraq and a law degree from Yale. Trump lauded Driscoll as a champion for soldiers and the America First agenda.

title: In first public address, Hasina accuses Yunus of 'genocide', persecuting minorities 'especially Hindus'
content: Ousted Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina accused interim leader Muhammad Yunus of orchestrating genocide against minorities. Speaking from New York, she alleged targeted attacks on Hindus, Buddhists, and Christians, claiming Yunus's regime was responsible. Hasina also revealed a plot to assassinate her and her sister, forcing her August resignation to prevent further bloodshed.
summary: Ousted Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina accused interim leader Muhammad Yunus of orchestrating genocide against minorities. Speaking from New York, she alleged targeted attacks on Hindus, Buddhists, and Christians, claiming Yunus's regime was responsible. Hasina also revealed a plot to assassinate her and her sister, forcing her August resignation to prevent further bloodshed.

title: Meet plaintiff in Supreme Court battle over gender-affirming care for trans minors
content: Memphis obstetrician-gynecologist Dr. Susan Lacy is challenging Tennessee's 2023 ban on gender-affirming care for minors. The Johns Hopkins graduate and founder of Modern Gynecology & Reproductive Health provides care for hundreds of transgender patients, advocating for their rights amidst restrictive legislation. Beyond her practice, Dr. Lacy is a community activist, serving on environmental and public health boards.
summary: Memphis obstetrician-gynecologist Dr. Susan Lacy is challenging Tennessee's 2023 ban on gender-affirming care for minors.  The Johns Hopkins graduate and founder of Modern Gynecology & Reproductive Health provides care for hundreds of transgender patients, advocating for their rights amidst restrictive legislation.  Beyond her practice, Dr. Lacy is a community activist, serving on environmental and public health boards.

title: Yunus slams 'propaganda by big countries' to discredit Bangladesh uprising
content: Bangladesh's interim leader Muhammad Yunus appeals for national unity amid accusations of a foreign-led campaign to discredit his government. Ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, now in New York, accuses Yunus of "genocide" against minorities and alleges a plot to assassinate her and her sister.
summary: Bangladesh's interim leader Muhammad Yunus appeals for national unity amid accusations of a foreign-led campaign to discredit his government. Ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, now in New York, accuses Yunus of "genocide" against minorities and alleges a plot to assassinate her and her sister.

title: Trump may replace Pete Hegseth with Ron DeSantis for Pentagon role
content: President-elect Trump is reportedly reconsidering Pete Hegseth's nomination for Defense Secretary amid allegations of misconduct. Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, a former Navy officer and Trump's 2024 primary rival, is being considered as a potential replacement. Hegseth faces scrutiny over sexual misconduct accusations and financial mismanagement, causing concern among Senate Republicans.
summary: President-elect Trump is reportedly reconsidering Pete Hegseth's nomination for Defense Secretary amid allegations of misconduct. Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, a former Navy officer and Trump's 2024 primary rival, is being considered as a potential replacement. Hegseth faces scrutiny over sexual misconduct accusations and financial mismanagement, causing concern among Senate Republicans.

title: Putin's 'peace' cat to Japan dies
content: Mir, the Siberian cat gifted to Japan's Akita Governor by Russian President Vladimir Putin in 2012, has passed away at age 12. The feline, named "peace" in Russian, was given in return for an Akita dog presented to Putin after the 2011 Fukushima disaster.
summary: Mir, the Siberian cat gifted to Japan's Akita Governor by Russian President Vladimir Putin in 2012, has passed away at age 12. The feline, named "peace" in Russian, was given in return for an Akita dog presented to Putin after the 2011 Fukushima disaster.

title: Jill Biden’s final trip as first lady to conclude at Notre Dame reopening with Donald Trump
content: First Lady Jill Biden embarked on a six-day, four-nation international trip, focusing on military families, education, cancer research, and women's health. Her itinerary includes Italy, the UAE, Qatar, and France, culminating in attending the Notre Dame reopening. This marks her tenth solo international trip as first lady.
summary: First Lady Jill Biden embarked on a six-day, four-nation international trip, focusing on military families, education, cancer research, and women's health.  Her itinerary includes Italy, the UAE, Qatar, and France, culminating in attending the Notre Dame reopening. This marks her tenth solo international trip as first lady.

title: US senator Chuck Schumer dodges questions on Joe Biden’s pardon of Hunter Biden: 'I got nothin' for ya'
content: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer repeatedly refused to comment on President Biden's pardon of his son, Hunter. When pressed by reporters about the controversial decision, Schumer offered only, "I got nothin' for ya." The pardon covers Hunter Biden's federal gun and tax charges and has drawn criticism from both Democrats and Republicans.
summary: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer repeatedly refused to comment on President Biden's pardon of his son, Hunter.  When pressed by reporters about the controversial decision, Schumer offered only, "I got nothin' for ya."  The pardon covers Hunter Biden's federal gun and tax charges and has drawn criticism from both Democrats and Republicans.

title: Leading contenders who might replace South Korean President Yoon
content: South Korea's President Yoon Suk Yeol's martial law U-turn has fueled speculation about his future. Opposition leader Lee Jae-myung, Yoon's ruling party leader Han Dong-hoon, and former presidential aide Cho Kuk are potential successors. Legal battles and policy differences shape their paths to power. The political landscape remains uncertain. South Korea awaits its next leader.
summary: South Korea's President Yoon Suk Yeol's martial law U-turn has fueled speculation about his future.  Opposition leader Lee Jae-myung, Yoon's ruling party leader Han Dong-hoon, and former presidential aide Cho Kuk are potential successors.  Legal battles and policy differences shape their paths to power. The political landscape remains uncertain. South Korea awaits its next leader.

title: Donald Trump’s FBI pick Kash Patel targeted by Iranian hackers: Report
content: Indian-American lawyer Kash Patel, selected by Trump to lead the FBI, was notified by the bureau about being targeted by Iranian hackers. This follows a series of foreign hacking attempts targeting Trump associates. Relations between the US and Iran remain strained, exacerbated by ongoing tensions involving Israel and Gaza.
summary: Indian-American lawyer Kash Patel, selected by Trump to lead the FBI, was notified by the bureau about being targeted by Iranian hackers. This follows a series of foreign hacking attempts targeting Trump associates. Relations between the US and Iran remain strained, exacerbated by ongoing tensions involving Israel and Gaza.

title: Who is Chase Strangio? First transgender lawyer to argue before US supreme court
content: Chase Strangio, a transgender attorney with the ACLU, will make history by arguing before the US Supreme Court in United States v Skrmetti, challenging Tennessee's ban on gender-affirming care for minors. The case will determine if the law violates the Equal Protection Clause, with significant implications for civil rights and transgender youth across America.
summary: Chase Strangio, a transgender attorney with the ACLU, will make history by arguing before the US Supreme Court in United States v Skrmetti, challenging Tennessee's ban on gender-affirming care for minors. The case will determine if the law violates the Equal Protection Clause, with significant implications for civil rights and transgender youth across America.

title: 'This needs to stop now': Bill Ackman slams Joe Biden's 'deep state' labour deals before Donald Trump takes office
content: Bill Ackman accuses President Biden of attempting to solidify the Deep State with long-term contracts before leaving office, making it challenging for Trump's team to succeed. The Biden administration’s deal with the SSA ensures telework protections for thousands of employees until 2029, while Trump’s team plans significant budget cuts and the elimination of work-from-home policies.
summary: Bill Ackman accuses President Biden of attempting to solidify the Deep State with long-term contracts before leaving office, making it challenging for Trump's team to succeed. The Biden administration’s deal with the SSA ensures telework protections for thousands of employees until 2029, while Trump’s team plans significant budget cuts and the elimination of work-from-home policies.

title: Trump's pick Chad Chronister withdraws from DEA nomination, cites commitment to local duties
content: Sheriff Chad Chronister from Hillsborough withdrew his candidacy for Administrator of the US Drug Enforcement Administration. He cited his commitment to local initiatives as the reason. The decision drew mixed reactions. Some praised his withdrawal while others criticized his past actions during the COVID-19 pandemic. Congressman Thomas Massie and commentator Liz Wheeler were among the critics.
summary: Sheriff Chad Chronister from Hillsborough withdrew his candidacy for Administrator of the US Drug Enforcement Administration. He cited his commitment to local initiatives as the reason. The decision drew mixed reactions. Some praised his withdrawal while others criticized his past actions during the COVID-19 pandemic. Congressman Thomas Massie and commentator Liz Wheeler were among the critics.

title: Two dead after Tesla crashes into rock barrier and catches fire in New York
content: Two people died after a Tesla crashed into a rock barrier and caught fire in Pelham Manor, New York. The vehicle collided with the barrier around 9:15 am, leading to a fire exacerbated by the car's lithium-ion battery. The accident follows a similar recent crash involving a Tesla Cybertruck in California.
summary: Two people died after a Tesla crashed into a rock barrier and caught fire in Pelham Manor, New York. The vehicle collided with the barrier around 9:15 am, leading to a fire exacerbated by the car's lithium-ion battery. The accident follows a similar recent crash involving a Tesla Cybertruck in California.

title: 'Obligation to protect its minority': US Congressman lawmaker calls for protection of Hindus in Bangladesh
content: US Congressman Brad Sherman stresses that Bangladesh's interim government must protect its Hindu minority and address their grievances amidst violent unrest. An urgent call for investigation by the UN highlights the concern. Protests continued near the White House, demanding freedom for Hindu monk Chinmoy Krishna Brahmachari, who faces life threats in custody.
summary: US Congressman Brad Sherman stresses that Bangladesh's interim government must protect its Hindu minority and address their grievances amidst violent unrest. An urgent call for investigation by the UN highlights the concern. Protests continued near the White House, demanding freedom for Hindu monk Chinmoy Krishna Brahmachari, who faces life threats in custody.

title: Hunter Biden owes over $300,000 in unpaid rent, claims venture capitalist Shaun Maguire
content: After President Biden's pardon for his son Hunter, allegations about unpaid rent have resurfaced. Venture capitalist Shaun Maguire claims Hunter owes over $300,000 in back rent for a Venice, California property. Maguire said Hunter didn't pay rent and tried to compensate with his own feces artwork. The pardon doesn't cover civil issues like unpaid rent.
summary: After President Biden's pardon for his son Hunter, allegations about unpaid rent have resurfaced. Venture capitalist Shaun Maguire claims Hunter owes over $300,000 in back rent for a Venice, California property. Maguire said Hunter didn't pay rent and tried to compensate with his own feces artwork. The pardon doesn't cover civil issues like unpaid rent.

title: No lawyer shows up for monk in B'desh court
Gladiator for a night at the Colosseum? Some Romans are up in arms
US President-elect Donald Trump’s legal team moves to dismiss hush money case
content: US President-elect Donald Trump's legal team has filed a motion seeking to dismiss his hush money conviction, arguing it disrupts presidential duties and undermines voters' mandate. The case involves 34 counts of falsifying business records related to a payment to Stormy Daniels. Trump's lawyers claim the prosecution is politically motivated and seek to delay sentencing until 2029.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump's legal team has filed a motion seeking to dismiss his hush money conviction, arguing it disrupts presidential duties and undermines voters' mandate. The case involves 34 counts of falsifying business records related to a payment to Stormy Daniels. Trump's lawyers claim the prosecution is politically motivated and seek to delay sentencing until 2029.

title: NYC mayor backs deportation of migrants, seeks collaboration with Trump admin
content: New York City Mayor Eric Adams plans to deport migrants charged with crimes, changing his stance from awaiting convictions. Adams intends to work with the Trump administration to address public safety concerns, while still supporting law-abiding undocumented immigrants. This highlights a significant shift in the city’s immigration policy discourse.
summary: New York City Mayor Eric Adams plans to deport migrants charged with crimes, changing his stance from awaiting convictions. Adams intends to work with the Trump administration to address public safety concerns, while still supporting law-abiding undocumented immigrants. This highlights a significant shift in the city’s immigration policy discourse.
